DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Diagnostic procedure use drug EF5 detect presence oxygen tumor cell may help plan effective treatment solid tumor . PURPOSE : Phase II trial compare diagnostic procedure use EF5 method detect oxygen level tumor cell patient head neck cancer .
DOC.brief_title: EF5 Compared With Other Methods Detecting Oxygen Levels Tumor Cells Patients With Head Neck Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine distribution , degree , intrapatient interpatient heterogeneity hypoxia , measure EF5 bind tumor tissue , patient head neck cancer . - Determine distribution intrapatient interpatient heterogeneity CA9 expression , measure immunohistochemically , patient . - Determine distribution , concentration , intrapatient interpatient heterogeneity glucose lactate , measure bioluminescence imaging , patient . - Determine whether spatial coordination concentration lactate glucose location tissue hypoxia patient . - Determine whether spatial coordination location CA9 hypoxia and/or lactate concentration patient . OUTLINE : Patients receive EF5 IV 1-2.5 hour day 1 . Within 24-55 hour EF5 infusion , patient undergo surgery . Tumor tissue sample examine EF5 bind immunohistochemistry , bioluminescence imaging , flow cytometry . Patients follow 1 month survival . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : Approximately 20 patient accrue study within 1 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm squamous cell carcinoma head neck Clinically detectable disease physical examination radiographic study Scheduled undergo surgical resection tumor radiotherapeutic treatment PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age 18 Performance status Karnofsky 70100 % Life expectancy Not specify Hematopoietic WBC great 3,000/mm^3 Platelet count great 100,000/mm^3 Hepatic Bilirubin great 1.5 mg/dL Renal Creatinine great 1.8 mg/dL Other No allergy IV contrast dye No prior grade III IV peripheral neuropathy Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception 1 week study participation PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy Not specify Chemotherapy Not specify Endocrine therapy Not specify Radiotherapy See Disease Characteristics Concurrent radiotherapy allow Surgery See Disease Characteristics
